macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Trump's Greenland Acquisition Threats Trigger US Stock Sell-Off
items.summary: US equities declined sharply with the S&P 500 down 1.2% midday after Donald Trump's statements on acquiring Greenland and escalated tariff threats against European nations. Wall Street saw opening bell sell-offs, marking the worst S&P 500 session since October 2025 on January 20.

items.title: UK Inflation Rises Unexpectedly in December, FTSE Slides on Weak Labour Data
items.summary: UK headline inflation rose more than expected due to higher cigarette prices and airfares, while FTSE 100 fell 0.8% to 10,116.14 amid weak labour market data.

items.title: Major Indexes End Week Lower Ahead of Fed Meeting and Tech Earnings
items.summary: Dow Jones fell 0.5%, S&P 500 down 0.4%, and Nasdaq Composite off 0.1% for the week ending January 23, marking the second consecutive down week. Investors await Fed announcements and earnings from Microsoft, Meta, Tesla, and Apple this week.

items.title: Semiconductor Equipment Stocks Surge Double-Digits in 2026 YTD
items.summary: Every stock in the S&P 500 semiconductor equipment group is up double-digits YTD, led by Lam Research (+33.4%), Applied Materials (+26.6%), and KLA (+25.1%), boosted by TSMC's capex announcement and AI trends.

items.title: Indian Markets Volatile on Global Trade Tensions and Adani Declines
items.summary: Sensex and Nifty50 slid nearly 1% on January 23 amid US tariff threats and Adani Group declines from US SEC headlines, though they rallied earlier on diplomatic shifts.

items.title: Gold Prices Hit $4,970/oz Amid Geopolitical Uncertainty
items.summary: Spot gold rose to $4,970 per ounce on Thursday evening as safe-haven demand increased due to US threats over Greenland and tariff escalations.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Drops 1.07% to $2.99T Amid Broad Declines
items.summary: The total cryptocurrency market capitalization fell 1.07% over the last 24 hours to $2.99T, with Bitcoin trading down 1.30% at $88,455 after fluctuating between $88,136 and $89,676. Major coins like Ethereum (-0.87%), BNB (-1.33%), and XRP (-1.29%) also declined, while outperformers included NOM (+115%), ZKC (+70%), and ENSO (+69%).

items.title: Brazil's Central Bank Releases Guidelines for Crypto Businesses
items.summary: Brazil's Central Bank has issued new guidelines for cryptocurrency businesses, marking a step toward regulated operations in the country.

items.title: U.S. Senate Bill Proposes CFTC Oversight of Spot Crypto Markets
items.summary: A new U.S. Senate bill aims to place spot cryptocurrency markets under the oversight of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), with an upcoming hearing to address key legislation.

items.title: Oklahoma Bill Proposes Bitcoin Payments for State Employees and Businesses
items.summary: Legislation in Oklahoma seeks to allow Bitcoin payments for state employees and businesses, promoting crypto adoption at the state level.

items.title: Crypto Dispensers Sets New Standard for Regulated Cash-to-Bitcoin Infrastructure
items.summary: Crypto Dispensers, under Virtual Assets, Inc., highlighted its compliant cash-to-Bitcoin platform amid past legal challenges related to a prior entity, emphasizing ongoing operations and partnerships with banks and retail chains.

items.title: Analysts Predict Bitcoin Could Double to $200K, Ethereum and XRP to Skyrocket in 2026
items.summary: Experts forecast Bitcoin reaching $200,000 due to institutional adoption, Ethereum benefiting from DeFi and RWA tokenization, and XRP potentially hitting $8 amid Ripple strategies.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: ISTA Secures €5 Million Donation from Garrett Camp for Trustworthy AI Research
items.summary: The Institute of Science and Technology Austria (ISTA) received a €5 million donation from Garrett Camp to advance research in reliable, sustainable, and causal AI, including work on AlphaFold3 integration and privacy-preserving language models by researchers like Christoph Lampert, Dan Alistarh, and Francesco Locatello.

items.title: Study Shows AI Matches Average Human Creativity, Lags Behind Top Humans
items.summary: A large-scale study from Université de Montréal compared leading LLMs like GPT-4, Claude, and Gemini against 100,000 humans on creativity tasks, finding AI now outperforms average human levels but falls short of the most creative individuals; published January 21, 2026.

items.title: Northeastern University Launches London AI Tech Hub with IBM Collaboration
items.summary: Northeastern's new London campus hub focuses on next-gen AI hardware with IBM, AI misbehavior detection in LLMs like ChatGPT, neuromorphic and quantum computing, and efficient LLM accelerators funded by ERC and UK ARIA.

items.title: AI Lacrosse Coach Platform Launches for 24/7 Player Development
items.summary: AILacrosseCoach.com debuted a generative AI platform offering instant tactical analysis, positional training, and recruiting insights for lacrosse players ahead of the 2026 season, with a pilot for youth programs.

items.title: Dynamic Risk Deploys AI for Fleet Safety with Machine Vision
items.summary: Dynamic Risk introduced an AI solution combining machine vision and cloud cameras for enhanced fleet safety monitoring, announced January 25, 2026.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Six New Demos Added to Xbox in 2026, Including Major Titles
items.summary: Xbox has released six new game demos so far in 2026, with major additions including Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Tides, Code Vein 2, and Dragon Quest VII Reimagined. Some demos allow progress to carry over to the full game.

items.title: 20+ Games Coming to Xbox Next Week (January 26-30)
items.summary: Xbox is releasing over 20 games in the coming week, with highlights including Code Vein 2 and free-to-play shooter Highguard, plus five new Xbox Game Pass titles.

items.title: 10 Games Joining Xbox Game Pass (January 21 - February 3)
items.summary: Microsoft announced 10 new titles for Xbox Game Pass through early February, including major additions like Space Marine 2, Death Stranding, and Ninja Gaiden Ragebound.

items.title: Fallout 1 and 2 Free for Prime Gaming Subscribers
items.summary: Prime Gaming subscribers can claim Fallout 1 and Fallout 2 for free until January 26.

items.title: LA Kings Defeat St. Louis Blues 5-4 in Shootout
items.summary: The Los Angeles Kings earned consecutive victories with a 5-4 shootout win over the St. Louis Blues on January 24, with Trevor Moore scoring a crucial goal in his return from injury.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Toyota Recalls 162,000 Pickup Trucks Over Faulty Multimedia Displays
items.summary: Toyota announced a recall of about 162,000 pickup trucks in the United States due to multimedia displays that could compromise driver safety.

items.title: The Sun Releases Largest Solar Particle Event Towards Earth Since 2003
items.summary: The Sun has unleashed the largest solar particle event directed at Earth since the 2003 Halloween solar storms, marking a significant space weather development.
